name: Ranger
description: A warrior who uses martial prowess and nature magic to combat threats on the edges of civilization.

1.name: Favored Enemy
1.description: Beginning at 1st level, you have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even talking to a certain type of enemy. Choose a type of favored enemy: aberrations, beasts, celestials, constructs, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, giants, monstrosities, oozes, plants, or undead. Alternatively, you can select two races of humanoid (such as gnolls and orcs) as favored enemies.

options.name: Aberrations
options.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track aberrations, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

options.name: Beasts
options.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track beasts, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

options.name: Celestials
options.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track celestials, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

options.name: Constructs
options.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track constructs, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

options.name: Dragons
options.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track dragons, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

options.name: Elementals
options.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track elementals, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

options.name: Fey
options.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track fey, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

options.name: Fiends
options.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track fiends, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

options.name: Giants
options.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track giants, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

options.name: Monstrosities
options.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track monstrosities, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

options.name: Oozes
options.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track oozes, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

options.name: Plants
options.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track plants, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

options.name: Undead
options.description: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track undead, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

options.name: Humanoids (Two Races)
options.description: You can select two races of humanoid (such as gnolls and orcs) as favored enemies. You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track these humanoids, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

1.name: Natural Explorer
1.description: You are particularly familiar with one type of natural environment and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions. Choose one type of favored terrain: arctic, coast, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, swamp, or the Underdark. When you make a Wisdom (Survival) check related to your favored terrain, your proficiency bonus is doubled if you are using a skill that you're proficient in. While traveling for an hour or more in your favored terrain, you remain alert to danger, and if you are traveling alone, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.

options.name: Arctic
options.description: You are particularly familiar with arctic terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

options.name: Coast
options.description: You are particularly familiar with coastal terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

options.name: Desert
options.description: You are particularly familiar with desert terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

options.name: Forest
options.description: You are particularly familiar with forest terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

options.name: Grassland
options.description: You are particularly familiar with grassland terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

options.name: Mountain
options.description: You are particularly familiar with mountain terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

options.name: Swamp
options.description: You are particularly familiar with swamp terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

options.name: Underdark
options.description: You are particularly familiar with Underdark terrain and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

2.name: Fighting Style
2.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options:

options.name: Archery
options.description: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

options.name: Defense
options.description: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

options.name: Dueling
options.description: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

options.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
options.description: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

2.name: Spellcasting
2.description: You have learned to use the magical essence of nature to cast spells, much as a druid does. You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the ranger spell list. You learn additional ranger spells of your choice at higher levels. The Spells Known column shows when you learn more ranger spells.

3.name: Ranger Conclave
3.description: You choose to emulate the ideals and training of a ranger conclave. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

3.name: Primeval Awareness
3.description: You can use your action and expend a spell slot to focus your awareness on the region around you. For 1 minute per level of the spell slot you expend, you can sense whether the following types of creatures are present within 1 mile of you (or within up to 6 miles if you are in your favored terrain): aberrations, celestials, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

6.name: Favored Enemy and Natural Explorer Improvements
6.description: You choose one additional favored enemy, as well as one additional favored terrain. The benefits of these features apply the same way as your first choices.

7.name: Ranger Conclave feature
7.description: You gain a feature from your Ranger Conclave.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

8.name: Land's Stride
8.description: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

9.name: Natural Awareness
9.description: Your connection to nature grants you heightened awareness while in natural environments.

mechanics.note: Level 9 typically has no new features for ranger - spellcasting progression only

10.name: Hide in Plain Sight
10.description: You can spend 1 minute creating camouflage for yourself. You must have access to fresh mud, dirt, plants, soot, and other naturally occurring materials with which to create your camouflage. Once you are camouflaged in this way, you can try to hide by pressing yourself up against a solid surface that is at least as tall and wide as you are. You gain a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks as long as you remain there without moving or taking actions.

11.name: Ranger Conclave feature
11.description: You gain a feature from your Ranger Conclave.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

13.name: Spellcasting Focus
13.description: Your magical connection to nature deepens, enhancing your spellcasting abilities.

mechanics.note: Level 13 typically has no new features for ranger - spellcasting progression only

14.name: Favored Enemy Improvement
14.description: You choose one additional favored enemy.

14.name: Vanish
14.description: You can use the Hide action as a bonus action on your turn. Also, you can't be tracked by nonmagical means, unless you choose to leave a trail.

15.name: Ranger Conclave feature
15.description: You gain a feature from your Ranger Conclave.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

17.name: Enhanced Spellcasting
17.description: Your mastery of ranger magic reaches new heights.

mechanics.note: Level 17 typically has no new features for ranger - spellcasting progression only

18.name: Feral Senses
18.description: You gain preternatural senses that help you fight creatures you can't see. When you attack a creature you can't see, your inability to see it doesn't impose disadvantage on your attack rolls against it. You are also aware of the location of any invisible creature within 30 feet of you, provided that the creature isn't hidden from you and you aren't blinded or deafened.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

20.name: Foe Slayer
20.description: You become an unparalleled hunter of your enemies. Once on each of your turns, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the attack roll or the damage roll of an attack you make against one of your favored enemies. You can choose to use this feature before or after the roll, but before any effects of the roll are applied.

subclasses.name: Hunter
subclasses.description: Emulating the Hunter archetype means accepting your place as a bulwark between civilization and the terrors of the wilderness.

3.name: Hunter's Prey
3.description: At 3rd level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

options.name: Colossus Slayer
options.description: Your tenacity can wear down the most potent foes. When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, the creature takes an extra 1d8 damage if it's below its hit point maximum. You can deal this extra damage only once per turn.

options.name: Giant Killer
options.description: When a Large or larger creature within 5 feet of you hits or misses you with an attack, you can use your reaction to attack that creature immediately after its attack, provided that you can see the creature.

options.name: Horde Breaker
options.description: Once on each of your turns when you make a weapon attack, you can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and within range of your weapon.

7.name: Defensive Tactics
7.description: At 7th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

options.name: Escape the Horde
options.description: Opportunity attacks against you are made with disadvantage.

options.name: Multiattack Defense
options.description: When a creature hits you with an attack, you gain a +4 bonus to AC against all subsequent attacks made by that creature for the rest of the turn.

options.name: Steel Will
options.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

11.name: Multiattack
11.description: At 11th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

options.name: Volley
options.description: You can use your action to make a ranged attack against any number of creatures within 10 feet of a point you can see within your weapon's range. You must have ammunition for each target, as normal, and you make a separate attack roll for each target.

options.name: Whirlwind Attack
options.description: You can use your action to make a melee attack against any number of creatures within 5 feet of you, with a separate attack roll for each target.

15.name: Superior Hunter's Defense
15.description: At 15th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

options.name: Evasion
options.description: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

options.name: Stand Against the Tide
options.description: When a hostile creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to force that creature to repeat the same attack against another creature (other than you) of your choice.

options.name: Uncanny Dodge
options.description: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

subclasses.name: Beast Master
subclasses.description: The Beast Master archetype embodies a friendship between the civilized races and the beasts of the world.

3.name: Ranger's Companion
3.description: You gain a beast companion that accompanies you on your adventures and is trained to fight alongside you. Choose a beast that is no larger than Medium and that has a challenge rating of 1/4 or lower. Add your proficiency bonus to the beast's AC, attack rolls, and damage rolls, as well as to any saving throws and skills it is proficient in. Its hit point maximum equals its normal maximum or four times your ranger level, whichever is higher.

7.name: Exceptional Training
7.description: Beginning at 7th level, on any of your turns when your beast companion doesn't attack, you can use a bonus action to command the beast to take the Dash, Disengage, or Help action on its turn.

11.name: Bestial Fury
11.description: Starting at 11th level, your beast companion can make two attacks when you command it to use the Attack action.

15.name: Share Spells
15.description: Beginning at 15th level, when you cast a spell targeting yourself, you can also affect your beast companion with the spell if the beast is within 30 feet of you.

subclasses.name: Gloom Stalker
subclasses.description: Gloom Stalkers are at home in the darkest places, using the shadows to their advantage.

3.name: Gloom Stalker Magic
3.description: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class. These spells count as ranger spells for you, but they don't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

3.name: Dread Ambusher
3.description: At 3rd level, you master the art of the ambush. You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier. At the start of your first turn of each combat, your walking speed increases by 10 feet, which lasts until the end of that turn. If you take the Attack action on that turn, you can make one additional weapon attack as part of that action. If that attack hits, the target takes an extra 1d8 damage of the weapon's damage type.

3.name: Umbral Sight
3.description: At 3rd level, you gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision from your race, its range increases by 30 feet. You are also adept at evading creatures that rely on darkvision. While in darkness, you are invisible to any creature that relies on darkvision to see you in that darkness.

7.name: Iron Mind
7.description: By 7th level, you have honed your ability to resist the mind-altering powers of your prey. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws. If you already have this proficiency, you instead gain proficiency in Intelligence or Charisma saving throws (your choice).

11.name: Stalker's Flurry
11.description: At 11th level, you learn to attack with such unexpected speed that you can turn a miss into another strike. Once on each of your turns when you miss with a weapon attack, you can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.

15.name: Shadowy Dodge
15.description: Starting at 15th level, you can dodge in unforeseen ways, with wisps of supernatural shadow around you. Whenever a creature makes an attack roll against you and doesn't have advantage on the roll, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on it. You must use this feature before you know the outcome of the attack roll.

subclasses.name: Horizon Walker
subclasses.description: Horizon Walkers guard the world against threats that originate from other planes.

3.name: Horizon Walker Magic
3.description: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class. These spells count as ranger spells for you, but they don't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

3.name: Detect Portal
3.description: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to magically sense the presence of a planar portal. As an action, you detect the distance and direction to the closest planar portal within 1 mile of you. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

3.name: Planar Warrior
3.description: At 3rd level, you learn to draw on the energy of the multiverse to augment your attacks. As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The next time you hit that creature on this turn with a weapon attack, all damage dealt by the attack becomes force damage, and the creature takes an extra 1d8 force damage. When you reach 11th level in this class, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

7.name: Ethereal Step
7.description: At 7th level, you learn to step through the Ethereal Plane. As a bonus action, you can cast the etherealness spell with this feature, without expending a spell slot, but the spell ends at the end of the current turn. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

11.name: Distant Strike
11.description: At 11th level, you gain the ability to pass between the planes in a blink of an eye. When you use the Attack action, you can teleport up to 10 feet before each attack to an unoccupied space you can see. If you attack at least two different creatures with the action, you can make one additional attack with it against a third creature.

15.name: Spectral Defense
15.description: At 15th level, your ability to move between planes enables you to slip through the multiverse to avoid an enemy's attack. When you take damage from an attack, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to all of that attack's damage on this turn.

subclasses.name: Monster Slayer
subclasses.description: You have dedicated yourself to hunting down dangerous creatures and supernatural threats.

3.name: Hunter's Sense
3.description: As an action, learn a creature's vulnerabilities, immunities, and resistances.

3.name: Slayer's Prey
3.description: As a bonus action, designate a creature as your prey for extra damage.

7.name: Supernatural Defense
7.description: Add 1d6 to saving throws against effects from your prey.

11.name: Magic-User's Nemesis
11.description: When your prey tries to teleport or cast a spell, you can use your reaction to make an attack and potentially stop them.

15.name: Slayer's Counter
15.description: If your prey forces you to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to make an attack against them.

subclasses.name: Fey Wanderer
subclasses.description: These rangers have strong ties to the Feywild and its creatures, gaining magical abilities from this connection.

3.name: Dreadful Strikes
3.description: Your strikes can be augmented with mind-scarring magic, dealing extra psychic damage.

3.name: Fey Wanderer Magic
3.description: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class.

3.name: Otherworldly Glamour
3.description: You can add your Wisdom modifier to Charisma checks.

7.name: Beguiling Twist
7.description: You can redirect enchantment and frightening effects to other creatures.

11.name: Fey Reinforcements
11.description: You can summon fey creatures to aid you in battle.

15.name: Misty Wanderer
15.description: You can cast misty step without expending a spell slot, and can bring one willing creature with you.

subclasses.name: Swarmkeeper
subclasses.description: These rangers bond with a swarm of nature spirits that aid them in combat and exploration.

3.name: Gathered Swarm
3.description: You manifest a swarm of nature spirits that can assist your attacks and movement.

3.name: Swarmkeeper Magic
3.description: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class.

7.name: Writhing Tide
7.description: You can move through the air using your swarm to carry you.

11.name: Mighty Swarm
11.description: Your swarm grows mightier, giving you additional options when you use Gathered Swarm.

15.name: Swarming Dispersal
15.description: You can turn into a swarm of tiny creatures when you would take damage.

subclasses.name: Drakewarden
subclasses.description: You have a special connection with drakes, magical creatures related to dragons.

3.name: Drake Companion
3.description: You can summon a drake companion that fights alongside you and grows stronger as you level up.

3.name: Draconic Gift
3.description: You can speak Draconic and gain a special benefit when you use the drake's breath weapon.

7.name: Drake Bond
7.description: Your drake can now fly and you can ride it as a mount.

11.name: Drake's Breath
11.description: You and your drake can use your actions together to unleash a powerful breath weapon.

15.name: Perfected Bond
15.description: Your drake grows to Large size and gains additional benefits.
